captions.text:
Hi, how are you doing?! My name is Otário (Sucker)!
And the Nestlé, decided to try to explain why

its Easter Eggs are so expensive, if
compared with the chocolate bars!
- Woooow, that's coooooool!

According to Nestlé, the eggs are more expensive 'cause they're products 
conceived not only to traditional intake, but for

gift and enchant.
[Little Otário] Wooo, that's coool!

Besides it, the production and distribution demands the
hiring of temporary manpower,

development of special package, manual process of 
packing, storing and special
transportation, among others.

You are kidding, right?!
For a brief time I thought this was about Fabergé's

Easter Eggs, true artworks
that, sometimes worth millions

of dollars.
But don't!

It's just about a shit of chocolate egg, 
which composition is basically:

sugar, unsaturated fat and just a little
reminder of cocoa...

But let's imagine that Nestlé is right
and that this special treatment justifies

these absurd prices of the easter eggs.
However, what Nestlé doesn't explain, is the increase

of almost 2 times above of the inflation value 
comparing to the easter egg prices in 2013, which

were already super inflated 
compared to the previous year.

They didn't explain also, why, despite the constant 
reduction in the weight of the products, the prices

are increasing in every passing year.
The true reason to the high prices,

not only in the easter eggs, but of
practically everything existent in Brazil...

It's, basically: the high tributary taxes,
huge profit margins and last,

but not least, why the fucking
Brazilian, DUMB, goes there and buy it!

So, why low the prices?!
Don't fuck with me!

The boycott is the most powerful weapon that the
customer has to its disposition to avoid these

kinds of abuses...
since, when you don't buy a product,

the company has two options:
low the profit margin, also pressing the
government to reduce the taxes, or bankrupt.

And if it goes bankrupt, it appears the opportunity
to other companies to arise, more modern, efficient

and with better prices... just like that!
Therefore, the power to change this reality

in Brazil, is in your hands!
You can boycott products or low quality services

and that have abusive prices. And if you can't 
boycott, search other options that can

give you the best benefit-cost (by the way, the  
internet is an excellent tool for it)
- Buh
[ Translation - Vitor Utrila ]
